Class Input

java.lang.Object
fr.florian.engine.io.Input
public class Input extends Object
Handles user input via keyboard, mouse, and scroll wheel using GLFW. Stores input state and provides access to real-time values.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Input()
    Initializes all GLFW input callbacks.

    • Input

      public Input()

  • Method Details

    • isKeyDown

      public static boolean isKeyDown(int key)
      Checks if a specific keyboard key is currently pressed.
      Parameters:
      key - GLFW key code.
      Returns:
      True if the key is down, false otherwise.

    • isButtonDown

      public static boolean isButtonDown(int button)
      Checks if a specific mouse button is currently pressed.
      Parameters:
      button - GLFW mouse button code.
      Returns:
      True if the button is down, false otherwise.

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Releases all GLFW input callbacks.

    • getMouseX

      public static double getMouseX()
      Returns:
      The current horizontal mouse position.

    • getMouseY

      public static double getMouseY()
      Returns:
      The current vertical mouse position.

    • getScrollX

      public static double getScrollX()
      Returns:
      Total horizontal scroll offset.

    • getScrollY

      public static double getScrollY()
      Returns:
      Total vertical scroll offset.

    • getKeyboardCallback

      public org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWKeyCallback getKeyboardCallback()
      Returns:
      The GLFW key callback used by this input manager.

    • getMouseMoveCallback

      public org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWCursorPosCallback getMouseMoveCallback()
      Returns:
      The GLFW cursor position callback.

    • getMouseButtonsCallback

      public org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWMouseButtonCallback getMouseButtonsCallback()
      Returns:
      The GLFW mouse button callback.

    • getMouseScrollCallback

      public org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWScrollCallback getMouseScrollCallback()
      Returns:
      The GLFW mouse scroll callback.

    • isLeftMouseDown

      public static boolean isLeftMouseDown()
      Returns:
      True if the left mouse button is currently held down.
